verses.verse: Now the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> gathered <S%H622><s%> their armies <S%H4264><s%> for battle; <S%H4421><s%> and they were gathered <S%H622><s%> at Socoh <S%H7755><s%> which <S%H834><s%> belongs to Judah, <S%H3063><s%> and they camped <S%H2583><s%> between <S%H996><s%> Socoh <S%H7755><s%> and Azekah, <S%H5825><s%> in Ephes-dammim.

And Saul <S%H7586><s%> and the men <S%H376><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> were gathered, <S%H622><s%> and camped <S%H2583><s%> in the valley <S%H6010><s%> of Elah, <S%H424><s%> and drew <S%H6186><s%> up in battle <S%H4421><s%> array to encounter <S%H7122><s%> the Philistines. <S%H6430><s%>

And the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> stood <S%H5975><s%> on the mountain <S%H2022><s%> on one <S%H2088><s%> side <S%H2088><s%> while Israel <S%H3478><s%> stood <S%H5975><s%> on the mountain <S%H2022><s%> on the other <S%H2088><s%> side, <S%H2088><s%> with the valley <S%H1516><s%> between <S%H996><s%> them.

Then a champion <S%H376><s%> <S%H996><s%> came <S%H3318><s%> out from the armies <S%H4264><s%> of the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> named <S%H8034><s%> Goliath, <S%H1555><s%> from Gath, <S%H1661><s%> whose height <S%H1363><s%> was six <S%H8337><s%> cubits <S%H520><s%> and a span. <S%H2239><s%>

And [he had] a bronze <S%H5178><s%> helmet <S%H3553><s%> on his head, <S%H7218><s%> and he was clothed <S%H3847><s%> with scale-armor which weighed <S%H4948><s%> five <S%H2568><s%> thousand <S%H505><s%> shekels <S%H8255><s%> of bronze. <S%H5178><s%>
[He] also [had] bronze <S%H5178><s%> greaves <S%H4697><s%> on his legs <S%H7272><s%> and a bronze <S%H5178><s%> javelin <S%H3591><s%> [slung] between <S%H996><s%> his shoulders. <S%H3802><s%>

And the shaft <S%H2671><s%> of his spear <S%H2595><s%> was like a weaver's beam, <S%H4500><s%> and the head <S%H3852><s%> of his spear <S%H2595><s%> [weighed] six <S%H8337><s%> hundred <S%H3967><s%> shekels <S%H8255><s%> of iron; <S%H1270><s%> his shield-carrier also walked <S%H1980><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> him.

And he stood <S%H5975><s%> and shouted <S%H7121><s%> to the ranks <S%H4634><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> and said <S%H559><s%> to them, "Why <S%H4100><s%> do you come <S%H3318><s%> out to draw <S%H6186><s%> up in battle <S%H4421><s%> array? Am I not the Philistine <S%H6430><s%> and you servants <S%H5650><s%> of Saul <S%H7586><s%>? Choose <S%H1262><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> for yourselves and let him come <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> to me.

"If <S%H518><s%> he is able <S%H3201><s%> to fight <S%H3898><s%> with me and kill <S%H5221><s%> me, then we will become <S%H1961><s%> your servants; <S%H5650><s%> but if <S%H518><s%> I prevail <S%H3201><s%> against him and kill <S%H5221><s%> him, then you shall become <S%H1961><s%> our servants <S%H5650><s%> and serve <S%H5647><s%> us."

Again the Philistine <S%H6430><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "I defy <S%H2778><s%> the ranks <S%H4634><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> this <S%H2088><s%> day; <S%H3117><s%> give <S%H5414><s%> me a man <S%H376><s%> that we may fight <S%H3898><s%> together. <S%H3162><s%>"

When Saul <S%H7586><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> Israel <S%H3478><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> these <S%H428><s%> words <S%H1697><s%> of the Philistine, <S%H6430><s%> they were dismayed <S%H2865><s%> and greatly <S%H3966><s%> afraid. <S%H3372><s%>

Now David <S%H1732><s%> was the son <S%H1121><s%> of the Ephrathite <S%H673><s%> of Bethlehem <S%H1035><s%> in Judah, <S%H3063><s%> whose name <S%H8034><s%> was Jesse, <S%H3448><s%> and he had eight <S%H8083><s%> sons. <S%H1121><s%> And Jesse was old <S%H2204><s%> in the days <S%H3117><s%> of Saul, <S%H7586><s%> advanced <S%H935><s%> [in years] among men. <S%H376><s%>

And the three <S%H7969><s%> older <S%H1419><s%> sons <S%H1121><s%> of Jesse <S%H3448><s%> had gone <S%H1980><s%> after <S%H310><s%> Saul <S%H7586><s%> to the battle. <S%H4421><s%> And the names <S%H8034><s%> of his three <S%H7969><s%> sons <S%H1121><s%> who <S%H834><s%> went <S%H1980><s%> to the battle <S%H4421><s%> were Eliab <S%H446><s%> the first-born, and the second <S%H4932><s%> to him Abinadab, <S%H41><s%> and the third <S%H7992><s%> Shammah. <S%H8048><s%>
And David <S%H1732><s%> was the youngest. <S%H6996><s%> Now the three <S%H7969><s%> oldest <S%H1419><s%> followed <S%H1980><s%> <S%H310><s%> Saul, <S%H7586><s%>
but David <S%H1732><s%> went <S%H1980><s%> <S%H7725><s%> back <S%H7725><s%> and forth from Saul <S%H7586><s%> to tend <S%H7462><s%> his father's flock <S%H6629><s%> at Bethlehem. <S%H1035><s%>

And the Philistine <S%H6430><s%> came <S%H5066><s%> forward <S%H5066><s%> morning <S%H7925><s%> and evening <S%H6150><s%> for forty <S%H705><s%> days, <S%H3117><s%> and took <S%H3320><s%> his stand. <S%H3320><s%>

Then Jesse <S%H3448><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to David <S%H1732><s%> his son, <S%H1121><s%> "Take <S%H3947><s%> now <S%H4994><s%> for your brothers <S%H251><s%> an ephah <S%H374><s%> of this <S%H2088><s%> roasted <S%H7039><s%> grain <S%H7039><s%> and these <S%H2088><s%> ten <S%H6235><s%> loaves, <S%H3899><s%> and run <S%H7323><s%> to the camp <S%H4264><s%> to your brothers. <S%H251><s%>

"Bring <S%H935><s%> also these <S%H428><s%> ten <S%H6235><s%> cuts <S%H2757><s%> of cheese <S%H2461><s%> to the commander <S%H8269><s%> of [their] thousand, <S%H505><s%> and look <S%H6485><s%> into the welfare <S%H7965><s%> of your brothers, <S%H251><s%> and bring <S%H3947><s%> back news <S%H6161><s%> of them.

"For Saul <S%H7586><s%> and they and all <S%H3605><s%> the men <S%H376><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> are in the valley <S%H6010><s%> of Elah, <S%H424><s%> fighting <S%H3898><s%> with the Philistines. <S%H6430><s%>"

So David <S%H1732><s%> arose <S%H7925><s%> early <S%H7925><s%> in the morning <S%H1242><s%> and left <S%H5203><s%> the flock <S%H6629><s%> with a keeper <S%H8104><s%> and took <S%H5375><s%> [the supplies] and went <S%H1980><s%> as Jesse <S%H3448><s%> had commanded <S%H6680><s%> him. And he came <S%H935><s%> to the circle <S%H4570><s%> of the camp <S%H4570><s%> while the army <S%H2428><s%> was going <S%H3318><s%> out in battle <S%H4634><s%> array <S%H4634><s%> shouting <S%H7321><s%> the war <S%H4421><s%> cry. <S%H7321><s%>
And Israel <S%H3478><s%> and the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> drew <S%H6186><s%> up in battle <S%H6186><s%> array, army <S%H4634><s%> against <S%H7122><s%> army. <S%H4634><s%>

Then David <S%H1732><s%> left <S%H5203><s%> his baggage <S%H3627><s%> in the care <S%H3027><s%> of the baggage <S%H3627><s%> keeper, <S%H8104><s%> and ran <S%H7323><s%> to the battle <S%H4634><s%> line <S%H4634><s%> and entered <S%H935><s%> in order to greet <S%H7592><s%> <S%H7965><s%> his brothers. <S%H251><s%>

As he was talking <S%H1696><s%> with them, behold, <S%H2009><s%> the champion, <S%H376><s%> <S%H996><s%> the Philistine <S%H6430><s%> from Gath <S%H1661><s%> named <S%H8034><s%> Goliath, <S%H1555><s%> was coming <S%H5927><s%> up from the army <S%H4634><s%> of the Philistines, <S%H6430><s%> and he spoke <S%H1696><s%> these <S%H428><s%> same <S%H428><s%> words; <S%H1697><s%> and David <S%H1732><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> [them].
When all <S%H3605><s%> the men <S%H376><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> the man, <S%H376><s%> they fled <S%H5127><s%> from him and were greatly <S%H3966><s%> afraid. <S%H3372><s%>

And the men <S%H376><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "Have you seen <S%H7200><s%> this <S%H2088><s%> man <S%H376><s%> who is coming <S%H5927><s%> up? Surely <S%H3588><s%> he is coming <S%H5927><s%> up to defy <S%H2778><s%> Israel. <S%H3478><s%> And it will be that the king <S%H4428><s%> will enrich <S%H6238><s%> the man <S%H376><s%> who <S%H834><s%> kills <S%H5221><s%> him with great <S%H1419><s%> riches <S%H6239><s%> and will give <S%H5414><s%> him his daughter <S%H1323><s%> and make <S%H6213><s%> his father's house <S%H1004><s%> free <S%H2670><s%> in Israel. <S%H3478><s%>"

Then David <S%H1732><s%> spoke <S%H559><s%> to the men <S%H376><s%> who were standing <S%H5975><s%> by him, saying, <S%H559><s%> "What <S%H4100><s%> will be done <S%H6213><s%> for the man <S%H376><s%> who <S%H834><s%> kills <S%H5221><s%> this <S%H1975><s%> Philistine, <S%H6430><s%> and takes <S%H5493><s%> away <S%H5493><s%> the reproach <S%H2781><s%> from Israel <S%H3478><s%>? For who <S%H4310><s%> is this <S%H2088><s%> uncircumcised <S%H6189><s%> Philistine, <S%H6430><s%> that he should taunt <S%H2778><s%> the armies <S%H4634><s%> of the living <S%H2416><s%> God <S%H430><s%>?"

And the people <S%H5971><s%> answered <S%H559><s%> him in accord with this <S%H2088><s%> word, <S%H1697><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> "Thus <S%H3541><s%> it will be done <S%H6213><s%> for the man <S%H376><s%> who <S%H834><s%> kills <S%H5221><s%> him."

Now Eliab <S%H446><s%> his oldest <S%H1419><s%> brother <S%H251><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> when he spoke <S%H1696><s%> to the men; <S%H376><s%> and Eliab's anger <S%H639><s%> burned <S%H2734><s%> against David <S%H1732><s%> and he said, <S%H559><s%> "Why <S%H4100><s%> have you come <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%>? And with whom <S%H4310><s%> have you left <S%H5203><s%> those <S%H2007><s%> few <S%H4592><s%> sheep <S%H6629><s%> in the wilderness <S%H4057><s%>? I know <S%H3045><s%> your insolence <S%H2087><s%> and the wickedness <S%H7455><s%> of your heart; <S%H3824><s%> for you have come <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> in order <S%H4616><s%> to see <S%H7200><s%> the battle. <S%H4421><s%>"
But David <S%H1732><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "What <S%H4100><s%> have I done <S%H6213><s%> now <S%H6258><s%>? Was it not just a question <S%H1697><s%>?"

Then he turned <S%H5437><s%> away <S%H5437><s%> <S%H681><s%> from him to another <S%H312><s%> and said <S%H559><s%> the same <S%H2088><s%> thing; <S%H1697><s%> and the people <S%H5971><s%> answered <S%H7725><s%> the same <S%H1697><s%> thing <S%H1697><s%> as before. <S%H7223><s%>

When the words <S%H1697><s%> which <S%H834><s%> David <S%H1732><s%> spoke <S%H1696><s%> were heard, <S%H8085><s%> they told <S%H5046><s%> [them] to Saul, <S%H7586><s%> and he sent <S%H3947><s%> for him.

And David <S%H1732><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Saul, <S%H7586><s%> "Let no <S%H408><s%> man's heart <S%H3820><s%> fail <S%H5307><s%> on account <S%H5921><s%> of him; your servant <S%H5650><s%> will go <S%H1980><s%> and fight <S%H3898><s%> with this <S%H2088><s%> Philistine. <S%H6430><s%>"

Then Saul <S%H7586><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to David, <S%H1732><s%> "You are not able <S%H3201><s%> to go <S%H1980><s%> against <S%H413><s%> this <S%H2088><s%> Philistine <S%H6430><s%> to fight <S%H3898><s%> with him; for you are [but] a youth <S%H5271><s%> while he has been a warrior <S%H4421><s%> from his youth. <S%H5271><s%>"

But David <S%H1732><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Saul, <S%H7586><s%> "Your servant <S%H5650><s%> was tending <S%H7462><s%> his father's sheep. <S%H6629><s%> When a lion <S%H738><s%> or a bear <S%H1677><s%> came <S%H935><s%> and took <S%H5375><s%> a lamb <S%H7716><s%> from the flock, <S%H5739><s%>

I went <S%H3318><s%> out after <S%H310><s%> him and attacked <S%H5221><s%> him, and rescued <S%H5337><s%> [it] from his mouth; <S%H6310><s%> and when he rose <S%H6965><s%> up against <S%H5921><s%> me, I seized <S%H2388><s%> [him] by his beard <S%H2206><s%> and struck <S%H5221><s%> him and killed <S%H4191><s%> him.

"Your servant <S%H5650><s%> has killed <S%H5221><s%> both <S%H1571><s%> the lion <S%H738><s%> and the bear; <S%H1677><s%> and this <S%H2088><s%> uncircumcised <S%H6189><s%> Philistine <S%H6430><s%> will be like one <S%H259><s%> of them, since <S%H3588><s%> he has taunted <S%H2778><s%> the armies <S%H4634><s%> of the living <S%H2416><s%> God. <S%H430><s%>"

And David <S%H1732><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "The Lord <S%H3068><s%> who <S%H834><s%> delivered <S%H5337><s%> me from the paw <S%H3027><s%> of the lion <S%H738><s%> and from the paw <S%H3027><s%> of the bear, <S%H1677><s%> He will deliver <S%H5337><s%> me from the hand <S%H3027><s%> of this <S%H2088><s%> Philistine. <S%H6430><s%>" And Saul <S%H7586><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to David, <S%H1732><s%> "Go, <S%H1980><s%> and may the Lord <S%H3068><s%> be with you."

Then Saul <S%H7586><s%> clothed <S%H3847><s%> David <S%H1732><s%> with his garments <S%H4055><s%> and put <S%H5414><s%> a bronze <S%H5178><s%> helmet <S%H6959><s%> on his head, <S%H7218><s%> and he clothed <S%H3847><s%> him with armor. <S%H8302><s%>

And David <S%H1732><s%> girded <S%H2296><s%> his sword <S%H2719><s%> over <S%H4480><s%> <S%H5921><s%> his armor <S%H4055><s%> and tried <S%H2974><s%> to walk, <S%H1980><s%> for he had not tested <S%H5254><s%> [them.] So David <S%H1732><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Saul, <S%H7586><s%> "I cannot <S%H3201><s%> <S%H3808><s%> go <S%H1980><s%> with these, <S%H428><s%> for I have not tested <S%H5254><s%> [them]." And David <S%H1732><s%> took <S%H5493><s%> them off. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H5921><s%>

And he took <S%H3947><s%> his stick <S%H4731><s%> in his hand <S%H3027><s%> and chose <S%H977><s%> for himself five <S%H2568><s%> smooth <S%H2512><s%> stones <S%H68><s%> from the brook, <S%H5158><s%> and put <S%H7760><s%> them in the shepherd's bag <S%H3627><s%> which <S%H834><s%> he had, even in [his] pouch, <S%H3219><s%> and his sling <S%H9521><s%> was in his hand; <S%H3027><s%> and he approached <S%H5066><s%> the Philistine. <S%H6430><s%>
Then the Philistine <S%H6430><s%> came <S%H1980><s%> on and approached <S%H7126><s%> David, <S%H1732><s%> with the shield-bearer in front <S%H6440><s%> of him.

When the Philistine <S%H6430><s%> looked <S%H5027><s%> and saw <S%H7200><s%> David, <S%H1732><s%> he disdained <S%H959><s%> him; for he was [but] a youth, <S%H5288><s%> and ruddy, <S%H132><s%> with a handsome <S%H3303><s%> appearance. <S%H4758><s%>

And the Philistine <S%H6430><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to David, <S%H1732><s%> "Am I a dog, <S%H3611><s%> that you come <S%H935><s%> to me with sticks <S%H4731><s%>?" And the Philistine <S%H6430><s%> cursed <S%H7043><s%> David <S%H1732><s%> by his gods. <S%H430><s%>

The Philistine <S%H6430><s%> also said <S%H559><s%> to David, <S%H1732><s%> "Come <S%H1980><s%> to me, and I will give <S%H5414><s%> your flesh <S%H1320><s%> to the birds <S%H5775><s%> of the sky <S%H8064><s%> and the beasts <S%H929><s%> of the field. <S%H7704><s%>"

Then David <S%H1732><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to the Philistine, <S%H6430><s%> "You come <S%H935><s%> to me with a sword, <S%H2719><s%> a spear, <S%H2595><s%> and a javelin, <S%H3591><s%> but I come <S%H935><s%> to you in the name <S%H8034><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> of hosts, <S%H6635><s%> the God <S%H430><s%> of the armies <S%H4634><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> whom <S%H834><s%> you have taunted. <S%H2778><s%>

"This <S%H2088><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> will deliver <S%H5462><s%> you up into my hands, <S%H3027><s%> and I will strike <S%H5221><s%> you down <S%H5221><s%> and remove <S%H5493><s%> your head <S%H7218><s%> from you. And I will give <S%H5414><s%> the dead <S%H6297><s%> bodies <S%H6297><s%> of the army <S%H4264><s%> of the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> this <S%H2088><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> to the birds <S%H5775><s%> of the sky <S%H8064><s%> and the wild <S%H9130><s%> beasts <S%H9130><s%> of the earth, <S%H776><s%> that all <S%H3605><s%> the earth <S%H776><s%> may know <S%H3045><s%> that there <S%H3426><s%> is a God <S%H430><s%> in Israel, <S%H3478><s%>
